titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an John Maynard Keynes, [25. 1. 1915]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original an der King's College Library in Cambridge; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (Letters, S. 111; deutsch: Briefe, S. 71; Cambridge Letters, S. 98; WiC, S. 79).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: Got your letter you wrote January 10th today. I'm very interested to hear that Russell has published a book lately. Could you possibly send it to me & let me pay you after the war? I'ld so much like to see it. By the way, you're quite wrong if you think that being a soldier prevents me from thinking about propositions. As a mater of fact I've done a good deal of logical work lately, & hope to do a good deal more soon. ‒ Please give my love to Johnson. The war hasn't altered my private feelings in the least (thank God!!) or rather: I think I've grown a little milder. I wonder if Russell has been able to make anything out from the notes I gave to Moore last Easter?
